    Portfolio

    Leeds Creative Labs: Bragg Edition Residency

    Paired with concrete scientists, we explored concrete as a sonic material through a variety of experiments.

    Site Gallery: Society of Explorers and Folk Forest

    A workshop for Site Gallery’s Society of Explorers exploring making musical instruments from DIY contact microphones and domestic objects.

    The House Organ

    In-house audio reports from the amateur avant-garde.

    UNIT(e) 2016

    10 week UNIT(e) Residency at g39 in Cardiff.

    Bitto Arts Trust: Gasworks Residency

    A Triangle Network Fellowship at Britto Arts Trust in Dhaka, Bangladesh in 2015

    Reactor Halls E14: Cables - Contact Mic Workshop

    Workshop conducted as part of the Rammel Club/Reactor Halls E14: Cables event.

    Rammel Club

    Nights of visionary global music in Nottingham, UK.

    FOAM

    One off 12” vinyl commission for Mat Jenner’s FOAM project.

    Improvisations: Series 1

    An ongoing archive of staged realities and material flows leaking into the world, inviting you to listen with the ‘ear of the imagination’.

    They Ain’t Fucked with the Milk since Louis Pasteur, Except Maybe Diluted It a Little Bit

    Sound installation and score drawing upon the alternative tuning systems of La Monte Young and the musical legacy of Sunny Murray.

    Optophonic Workshop

    I was invited to run a workshop as part of PS2N’s Optophonic Workshop.

    Rainforest IV

    Based upon David Tudor’s Rainforest IV (1973) and realised as a collaborative electronics workshop and performance.

    The Memory Project

    A realisation of the score ‘Do You Want To Expand Your Parameters Or Play Museums Like Some Dilettante’ is played back using vibrations to activate the windo...

    Do You Want To Expand Your Parameters Or Play Museums Like Some Dilettante

    Composed in response to Marvin Gaye Chetwynd’s exhibition at Nottingham Contemporary as part of their ‘Memory’ project and permanent collection.

    Audio Transducers Nepal

    In March 2014 I visited Nepal with my wife. I was there to run a workshop where we would turn objects in speakers allowing us to intervene locally with sound...

    Contact Mics Uganda

    A 2 day workshop ran in the Katwe slums of Nsambya in Kampala, Uganda during December 2013.

    A Walk by the Water

    Between the 25th and the 30th of September 2013, in groups and alone, we walked sections of the River Trent and Nottingham Canal. It was as if she knew we we...

    The Rusty Trombone of God

    Cardiff based DIY gig collective - bringing fringe highlights and dirt-rare performances to Cardiff between 2010 and 2012. And then Nottingham in 2013.

    When We Hit the Sky We Were High Over the Roofs, a Field of Gnarled Antennae

    Audio installation activating listeners through dynamically modulating sound in space.

    Lustfaust

    An exercise in fictional archives and mediated histories - focussing upon little-known, 1970s, German noise band, Lustfaust.
